result.execSummary:
The defendant Javik J Cruz Montanez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 343 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.   Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letter of support filed in court by Atty. Dorlack

Defendant Javik J Cruz Montanez in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #4. State makes recommendations. Atty. Dorlack makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #4

Imposed Sentence of:

5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 343 days)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: ## Years

Conditions of Probation:

-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances

COSTS:  $268.00 (Cash bail posted to be applied)

DNA Surcharge: $250.00  (Cash bail posted to be applied)

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Remaining Cash Bail to be refunded to poster.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on June 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Javik J Cruz Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of Waukesha police officer Tyler Lusmann sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Will.  Cross examination by Atty. Dorlack.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Will moves for bind over.  Atty. Dorlack makes closing statements.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for trial.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Court denies the motion.  Bail remains as fixed on October 27, 2015.  Bail can be addressed before the trial court judge at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
